comments.body:
The windows test is failing here because python interprets int as 32 bits be default in windows
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22513445/python-handles-long-ints-differently-on-windows-and-unix.
Arggg.
Hmm thanks, I'll look into that.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +89,93 @@        for key in result:
            assert (result[key] == expected_result[key]).all()
            assert result[key].dtype == expected_result[key].dtype

    # instances are correctly aggregated to dict of input name -> tensor
